fields.description:
Step to reproduce:

* Enable collaborative editing
* Create a new blog post, set blog post date to a historical date, e.g 31/12/2015
* Save the blog post

Expected: the blog post date is set as 31/12/2015

Actual: the blog post is set as the current date
fields.summary: Setting blog post date doesn't work if Collaborative Editing is enabled

fields.description:
When creating a reply to a comment through the notification drop-down (upper right corner), before the reply is sent, the message is lost when someone else makes another comment and causes the notification panel to refresh. 

h5.Repro Steps
- User 1 creates a new comment inline on a Page
- User 2 receives a notification that User 1 made a comment and composes a reply from the Notification drop-down menu
- User 1 replies to their comment inline on the Page
- Before User 2 can click reply, Notification drop-down menu closes, and page indicates that User 1 has left a Reply
fields.summary: Replies Made in Notification Bar Lost When Someone Else Makes Comment

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When exporting a Google Drive document into a MS Word doc (.doc/.docx) and then importing that document into Confluence, any URL links within the document are malformed as shown in this screenshot:
!malformed_urls.png|thumbnail!

In the original document, they looked like this: 
!google_urls.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a document in Google Docs
# Include a full URL (with https://) in the document
# Export the document to a .doc/.docx file
# Import the word document into Confluence as a page

h3. Expected Results
The document imports with the URLs and content displaying correctly.
h3. Actual Results
Full URLs from the .docx file appear like this:
{code}
{+}https://google.com/+ 
{code} 
h3.Workaround
Thus far the only workaround is to exclude https:// from the URLs in Google Doc before exporting the file to Word. Otherwise, you must copy the correct the URLs within the new Confluence page.
fields.summary: Google doc exported into MS Word and Imported into Confluence has malformed links

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using Style Macro, importing an external style sheet is not working. Defining a Stylesheet appears to be working. 

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud: 1000.81.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page.
# Click *Insert* > *Other Macros*
# Select the *Style* Macro 
# Specify a URL to import an external stylesheet 
# Save the page. 

h3. Expected Results
* The custom style sheets is not being applied when using the import parameter in Style Macro

h3. Actual Results
* The custom style sheets should be applied when using the import parameter in Style Macro

h3. Notes
* Tested in Confluence Server 5.9.4 and it works fine.

h3.Workaround
* Define a Style Sheet instead of Importing an External Style Sheet.
fields.summary: Importing an External Style Sheet is not working in Style Macro

fields.description:
Our customer has created a page that has "/" in the title i.e. "Foo / bar"

When linking to such page the URL appears as <hostname>/<contextpath>/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=NNNNNN

The page contains tasks assigned to people.

If one goes under My Profile/Tasks the "Task appears on" column has a link that simply glues "?focusedTaskId=XXX" without checking that URL already has query string started.

e.g.

<hostname>/<contextpath>/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1016151?focusedTaskId=8

Accessing such URL results in 404 - not found error
fields.summary: Broken links to tasks in "My Tasks" view if the link to the page itself uses viewpage.action notation

fields.description:
Inserting Markdown with a nested list (list in list), where the last list item is a nested item results in an error. 

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# create a new page in Confluence
# Click on the *Insert More Content* button and select *{ } Markup* from the list.
# Select *Markdown* from the dropdown box and then paste the following text into the Insert field:
{noformat}
1. This is the first list item. 
  * this is a nested item
  * this is also a nested item
{noformat}
# click Insert
_note in the [Markdown Syntax Guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Markdown+syntax+guide#Markdownsyntaxguide-Listinlist] it suggests this should work_

h3.  Expected Outcome

(_replicated in current cloud release as well as Confluence Server 5.8.5_)
A list in list is inserted into the confluence page

h3.  Actual Outcome

The list is not inserted 
An error is displayed *Wiki markup conversion errors
error : Internal Server Error*

h3. Workaround

Ending the list in an additional numbered list item below the nested list results in a list being inserted correctly.
fields.summary: Inserting Markdown with a nested list (list in list) gives error in some cases

*Expected*
Nothing happens

*Actual results*
A wiki markup macro is rendered.

fields.description:
Some images, when added to a table, shrink until they disappear. This doesn't happen to all images, showing that this is not an expected behavior.

The 'image1.png' attached is showing this behavior, while 'image2.png' is not. Their both PNG files, so the type is not the problem. 

The following video shows the shrinking behavior:
[^image_shrinking.mp4]

This is one with image2.png, which doesn't shrink:
[^image_other.mp4]

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a page in Confluence
# Add a table with a header and one line after that and 2 columns
# Merge the header (this is important)
# Add the text 'Atlassian' to the header and the first column of the second line
# Add 'image1.png' to the second column
# Increase the sidebar, giving less space to the table and images

*Expected behavior*
* Image does not disappear, like happens to image2
* A scrolling bar appears to allow user to see the rest of the image

*Actual behavior*
* The image shrinks until it disappears.
fields.summary: Some images in table are shrunk until disappearing when there isn't enough space

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 21 January 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,
 Thanks for watching and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with Confluence.

We have reviewed this further and this is what our findings on this bug :
h3. UPDATE:
 - The documentation provided has been reviewed and the sentence using Tab key within Confluence is no longer stated there
 - We have tested this out and here are our findings :

h4. In the old editor.
 - We can confirm that the Tab key does not work and that is expected since we have the indent button at the toolbar to indent text out. This is set by designed for the old editor

!indent old editor.png|thumbnail!
h4. In the new editor

This is also been rectified for new editor where the tab key does work
 - This information can be found in our editor roadmap : [Confluence Cloud Editor Roadmap|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-cloud-editor-roadmap-967314556.html] > text with indents{panel}
h3. Summary

The Confluence documentation states that pressing the *Tab* key within the Confluence Editor will indent the text ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Keyboard+Shortcuts]).
 However, this is not the case - it simply navigates the cursor from within the text editing downward to the *Save/Create* button.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a page and edit or create new page
 # Add title and text
 # Hit the "Tab" key when putting the cursor on the text

h3. Expected Results

It will indent the text
h3. Actual Results

Does not indent the text
h3. Workaround
h4. In old editor

Click on the indent button when clicking on the text
 !indent old editor.png|thumbnail!
h4. In new editor

New editor supports tab key for keyboards.
fields.summary: Tab Key does not Indent Text on Confluence Cloud/Firefox

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Tiny links can sometimes be automatically generated with same alphanumeric characters but in a different case.

e.g. 9e8UTJ vs 9E8utj

This then causes issues if you want to, for example, link the pages in JIRA and then create a JIRA issues macro narrowing down issues that have those pages linked to them. It doesn't differentiate since the JIRA JQL search is case insensitive.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.276.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Not possible to force generation of Confluence tiny links, but if you happen across any that match, try to link one each to an issue in JIRA, and then create JIRA Issues Macro in Confluence that refers to only one of the tiny links. Both will display.

h3. Expected Results
Confluence Tiny Links should never match each other, regardless of case.

h3. Actual Results
Links can accidentally match

h3.Workaround
It appears when you use the pageID link instead it will change to Tiny Link, so this is not a workaround. Suggestion is to either limit JIRA search using components or labels, or recreate the page to generate a new Tiny Link
fields.summary: Tiny Links can possible generate with same alphanumeric characters

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Searching for specific words in the Space name under the Space Directory Search Options "Filter" search box at:
- https://<INSTANCE_NAME>.atlassian.net/wiki/spacedirectory/view.action

Will return no results, using search terms such as:
- IT
- AND
- BUT
- THE
- A

h3. Environment
* Discovered in Confluence Cloud Version {{1000.110.0}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 1 or more spaces with reserved Word in the title of the space:
# Search for the reserved word in *Space Directory* >> *Filter* Search Box >> Enter

h3. Expected Results
Space contains the word in Space Title is located, as the search is only parsing Space Titles and should return results regardless of common wording

h3. Actual Results
No Results are found, and returns:
{quote}
No results found for -. Please try one of the following suggestions:
- Use more general search terms or consult the online documentation for tips.
- If you are filtering by space, content, last modification date or contributor, try removing or adjusting the filter
{quote}
 
h3. Notes
Impact comes into play when Using the word "IT" to identify Spaces used by the "Information Technology" department under the Industry Standard acronym.  The IT department cannot locate spaces with the IT tag, such as:
# IT Security
# IT Systems
# IT Test
# Documentation For IT
# Test IT
# IT_Test
# TEST_IT
# IT ... etc...

h3.Workaround
Using the Site Wide Search in the upper right without hitting the Return/Enter Key will locate spaces under this naming convention, and will allow for partial search but does not return full list of the content:
!Screen Shot 2016-05-31 at 10.39.16 AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Space Directory Filter Search Reserved Words cannot be searched

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the *Page Properties* macro is placed inside a *Numbered Headings* macro on a page, then the information will not be retrieved by the *Page Properties Report* and the message _No content found_ will be displayed.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert a *Numbered Headings* macro in a page
# In this *Numbered Headings*, place a *Page Properties* macro and fill the information you would like to be displayed in the *Page Properties Report*.

h3. Expected Results
The *Page Properties Report* should display the content according to what is filled in the *Page Properties* macro.

h3. Actual Results
The *Page Properties Report* displays _No content found_

h3.Workaround
Place the *Page Properties* macro outside of the *Numbered Headings* macro. The *Page Properties Report* will display the data correctly.
fields.summary: Page Properties Report macro can't display content if the Page Properties macro is placed inside a Numbered Headings

fields.description:
h3.Summary:
Error received when creating backup from Backup Manager

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Click the create backup button in backup manager with or without selecting Backup attachments

h3. Expected Results
Creates a backup

h3. Actual Results
When trying to create backup the following error occurs in the UI:

{code}
Woah! Something went wrong!
Unexpected error during export has occurred
{code}

fields.summary: Unable to create a backup in Confluence Cloud
Edit Confluence Page Option is Missing

fields.description:
Same behavior that was Fixed in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-28401 on version 5.5 but reoccurring in 5.6 confluence.

h3.Reproduce:
- create user with Full name *User One*
- @mention user in confluence
- change users Full Name to *anything else*
- try to @mention *anything else*

h3.expected
users full name anything else will be found and mentioned

h3.Actual
user not found
BUT ...
- you can still @mention *User One*
- on save the @mention changes to *anything else*
fields.summary: After user changes Full Name the @mention does not work correctly

fields.description:
If you have space administrator permissions, you can customise a blueprint template per space.  This allows you to add/remove stuff from the blueprint that is specific for your use case.

This list (and ability to customise the blueprint) is not possible until you create a page (from a blueprint).

Start from a brand new instance:
# Create a Space
# Go to Space Admin
# Go to Content Tools

Expected: Blueprints are all listed as per the documentation, and I can edit them.
Actual: No Blueprints listed.

I then created a page from a blueprint, then returned to this page, and all the blueprints were listed.
fields.summary: Blueprints not listed for Customisations

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you enter chart data as a table in the body of the macro placeholder, and the table contains JIRA Issue Macro configured to return Total Issue Count. Page Preview is displaying the chart correctly but once the page is saved, the page is not correctly rendering the table values. It also affects Jira Issue Macro configured to return in Table. 
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud: 1000.107.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a page and add *Chart Macro*.
 # Click the macro placeholder and choose *Edit*.
 # Enter data in a table using *JIRA Issue Macro* configured to return _Total Issues Count or Table_
 # Select Bar as _Chart Type_.
 # Click *Save* to add the chart to the page.
 # Click *Preview* to view the Chart.
 !Preview the Page.png|thumbnail!
 # Click *Save* to save the page.
 !After Saving the Page.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
 * The Chart should be displaying correctly after saving the page.

h3. Actual Results
 * The Chart would display correctly when you *Preview* the page but once the page is saved, the chart is not displayed according to the Jira Issue Values.
fields.summary: Chart Macro is Not Displaying Correctly When Chart Data contains JIRA Issue Macro

fields.description:
At Connect Week, Sascha from bitvoodoo noticed that the REST API documentation for getContent is incorrect on this page:

https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/REST/latest/#content-getContent

The mistake is in this example URL:

http://example.com/rest/api/content?spaceKey=TST&Title=Cheese&expand=space,body.view,version,container

The "title" property has an uppercase "T", which causes the filter not to be applied.
fields.summary: Incorrect cloud REST API documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence is no longer showing more than 10 favourite spaces in side bar under 'My Spaces'.

h3. Environment
Affected version is actually {{1000.177.1}}, but it was not available.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create more than 10 spaces (I used REST API)
# Create a user and log in as it
# Add all spaces as favourite

h3. Expected Results
All spaces are shown in sidebar as before.

h3. Actual Results
Only 10 spaces are shown.

We tested with 20 spaces and this is what we could see:
!spaces_in_sidebar.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: 'My Spaces' in sidebar is only showing 10 spaces

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an expand macro contains an include page macro and the included page has header formatted text, when a header format is specified immediately preceding the expand macro, formatting is thrown off and content gets pushed outside the expand macro.
\\
\\
h3. Environment
Cloud
\\
\\
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with a line of Header 3 formatted text in the body.
# Create another page with an expand macro in the body containing an include macro that includes the page created in step 1.
# Add some additional content below the include page macro within the expand macro.
# In the edit window of the page containing the expand macro, set the formatting immediately preceding the expand macro to Header 3.
# Preview the page and note that the preview indicates all content will be within the expand macro.
# Save the page

\\
h3. Expected Results
The content will all be contained within the expand macro.
\\
\\
h3. Actual Results
Content after the include page macro is pushed outside the expand macro.
\\
\\
h3.Workaround
Use paragraph formatting preceding the expand macro.
fields.summary: Header Formatting Causes Expand Macro Issues

fields.description:
# Create a macro with rich text body (eg: panel)

# Move the cursor outside the table but still inside the macro body

Expected:  Clicking on this icon while not inside a table should do nothing.

Actual: Clicking on this toolbar icon adds a row to the macro body row.  This creates a body row in the macro body which is corrupt storage format.

fields.description:
If a user has access to JIRA, but not Confluence, and try to go to a Confluence page, the access error page itself will have the hamburger menu with a full, unrestricted list of all links set up.

We have a couple links pointing to code repositories and an older, archived issue tracker. The former are restricted to internal development groups, while the latter is restricted to all internal employees. External user accounts can only see links to JIRA (if they have access to it) or Confluence (if they have access to it).

However, it's very easy for a user without Confluence access rights to find a link to a Confluence page, and once they get there, the page render ignores all navigator restrictions, and links to code repos and the old issue tracker show up in it.
fields.summary: Application Navigator shows full list of links, including restricted ones

!values.png|thumbnail!

Instead you see that 02/2015 is displayed and then 03/2015 is repeated a number of times. 

!chart.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Chart Macro - Time Series Chart - is displaying incorrect month values and data not corresponding to correct dates

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding Created vs Resolved Chart Macro it ignores Cumulative Totals field configured to Yes. 

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud: 1000.107.0
Gadgets Plugin: 8.0.0
Atlassian Gadgets API: 4.2.7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page and add *Created vs Resolved Chart Macro*.
# Insert Filter in the Created vs Resolved Chart Macro configuration.
# Set *Cumulative Tools* field to *Yes*.

h3. Expected Results
* The Created vs Resolved Chart should progressively add totals. 

h3. Actual Results
* The Created vs Resolved Chart is showing individual values for each period. 

h3. Workaround

fields.description:
h4. Summary:
If the user have different attachments (images) with the same name in different pages, A and B, for example, the copy and paste of the content from one to another won't replace the attachment (image) in render mode.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
1. Copy the content of a page into a new page.
2. Replace the images on the new page with updated images with the same name.
3. Click Save on the new page to save the page and its updates.
4. Click Edit on the original page.
5. Click Edit on the new page.
6. Copy all of the content (including the same-named updated image) from the new page to the original page. The image successfully copies.
7. Delete the original content from the original page, leaving only the updated content and updated image.
8. Click Save to close the page and save the changes.
h4. Results:
*Expected result:*
1. The newly copied content is saved on the original page, along with the same-named image that has been updated. The new image is saved as a new version.
*Actual result:*
1. The page registers that an image of xxx.jpg or xxx.png is there, but does not register that it is a different version.

*Suggestion:* have the system check against the Date_Created and Date_Modified fields or the parameters of the image to see whether it is the same image or a new version of the image.
Attach one or more files to this issue
fields.summary: Copied and pasted updated images not being registered as updated on Save

fields.description:
h3. Summary
With the introduction of [Atlassian Accounts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Purchasing/Introducing+Atlassian+account], customer have to log-in using their email address as their username. 

However, there is something in Confluence that prevents the email address to be used to successfully authenticate REST API calls.

h3. Environment
Version 1000.85.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# use curl to send a REST request to any endpoint in Confluence sending -u myEmail:myPassword:
#- {noformat}curl -u EMAIL:PASSWORD https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
The request is successfully authenticated and you get the REST response back

h3. Actual Results
Confluence rejects the credentials and you get error 401 unauthorized


h3.Workaround
Use the username to authenticate the REST requests (you can see it in the user management section of your Confluence instance):
{noformat}curl -u USERNAME:PASSWORD https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/{noformat}
fields.summary: Unable to authenticate Confluence REST API calls using the Atlassian Accounts username

fields.description:
I want to share an individual page with a confluence user. 
1. I created the account for the new user
2. I went to the page I want to share with him and selected his account in the share-function. This goes well, i.e. any type of warning appears that this user might not be able to access the chosen page.
3. The new user get the mail with the sharing notification, clicks on the provided link, but cannot access the page, instead he sees "Page not Found".

Is this normal? Does the user need to be invited to the respective space? Is it possible just to share one (1!) page to a user for him to edit it without having to share the whole space?

Thanks
fields.summary: Sharing individual pages does not work (or does it)?

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you've restricted a user from spaces in Confluence, if you link one of those spaces they're restricted from as a Knowledge Base in Service Desk, they will suddenly have access, even though they are not a Service Desk customer

h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk 3.2.0-OD-04-003-D20160224T230516
* Confluence Cloud 6.0.0-OD-2016.10.0-1050

h3. Steps to Reproduce
*In Confluence*
# Create a special group to use to restrict users, (e.g. {{restrictedusers}})
# Choose a user to restrict a project to. Remove access to default Confluence users group and make sure they are not a JIRA user.
# Add the user to the {{restrictedusers}} group.
# Go to Global Permissions and add {{restrictedusers}} to *Can Use* for Confluence.
# Navigate to one space that you will restrict. Add the {{restrictedusers}} group to have access to the space.
# When you login as the user, you should only have access to 1 space. You can see this from Space Directory.

*In JIRA Service Desk*
# Navigate to a Service Desk, go to *Project Settings > Knowledge Base*
# Select *Link to a Confluence Space*
# Select your application, and one of the spaces that the user does NOT have access to.
# Click *Link* and select *All active users and customers can access the knowledge base without a Confluence license.*
# Navigate back to the login with the restricted user, and now check your Space Directory. You will see that it has been added, even though the Confluence user has no access to JIRA service desk.

h3. Expected Results
User should not have been given access to something they were restricted from. 

h3. Actual Results
Instead, they are given access. I think the key here is that it says *All active users and customers can access the knowledge base without a Confluence license.*, So this would include all Confluence users, even those restricted. This is a security issue.

h3. Notes
This is especially bad due to the fact that once a user has been given access to a space as a knowledge base, it cannot be revoked, even if you remove access later:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-40890

h3.Workaround
No current workaround
fields.summary: Linking Service Desk Knowledge base grants restricted users access to space

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you add a link to a page by using Web Link then enter the URL of the other page. The link created will not work using Mobile App.
In addition, if a link is to any other location other than the current space, it will also not work in the Mobile App. Instead, it is redirected to the mobile browser.


h3. Environment
Android and iOS Mobile Apps

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Select a text in a page to insert the link 
# Choose Link 
# Select Web Link 
# Paste in the URL of the other page
# Access the page using Mobile App

h3. Expected Results
* The link should be accessible using Mobile App and thus open directly in the app

h3. Actual Results
* The link is not accessible using Mobile App, and instead opens in mobile browser.

h3.Workaround
* Use Link a Page and Search for the page name. 
* Note: this workaround does not work for links to a page in another space.
fields.summary: Link to a page outside of current space is redirected to mobile browser

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After the cloud upgrade today, 4 default plugins were not enabled properly when Confluence restarted. 

Plugins disabled:
* Confluence Inline Tasks
* Confluence Roadmap Planner
* Share Page
* Confluence Document Conversion Library
* Confluence Business Blueprints - Plugin
* Workbox - Confluence Provider Plugin

Newly provisioned instances are sometimes taking 10+minutes to start. When they do eventually start the same plugins are disabled.

h3. Expected Results
Macros will be displayed or used with no issues. 

h3. Actual Results
The customers see {noformat}"unknown macro <name_of_macro>"{noformat}

h3.Workaround
Re-enable the disabled add-on from UPM.
fields.summary: Confluence's plugins are not working and showing "unknown macro <name_of_macro>"

The Dashboard content of the current Confluence Cloud {{5.9.1-OD-2015.47.1-0002}} is untranslated. See also [the attached screenshot|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/182157/dashboard.png].

It is because Confluence Cloud is not using the latest Japanese language pack, but far old version:

There is no workaround unfortunately

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When ppt and pptx files are attached to a page in Confluence, we use the Office Powerpoint view file macro to display the file content on the page, although the layout is wrong due to the oversized images. We believe that this is happening due to the differences between Powerpoint application and Confluence renderer.

h3. Environment
Cloud - Confluence 1000.194.0
Chrome browser: Version 51.0.2704.103 (64-bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a page in Confluence
# Attach a powerpoint file to the page, the file must have an image and text on the same slide.
# Try to visualize the powerpoint slide with the images and text

* We've already tested multiple files in multiple instances, the error is always displayed
* Also we've tested the same file in PowerPoint (latest), LibreOffice, Google presentation mode and on the instance using powerpoint macro, only on Powerpoint worked perfectly.
* You can use the file attached to reproduce the issue, you can see the error on slide 11:  [^sample.ppt] 

h3. Expected Results
The file should be displayed as on PowerPoint

h3. Actual Results
Images are oversized and being displayed in front of texts, not allowing to read it.
 !Screen Shot 2016-08-01 at 11.50.34 AM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
Workaround is to use new view file macro . 
More information here: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Display+Files+and+Images]
fields.summary: pptx and ppt files oversized images

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Gliffy add-on can add a diagram outside the page layout section.
Removing the gliffy diagram content leaves a space between the page Title and the first Section of the page with content.

h3. Environment
Confluence
Gliffy add-on

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page with 2 page layout sections and a gliffy diagram
# save the page
# edit the page
# edit the Gliffy diagram and click on "save as" inside gliffy and the "this page" option.
# exit the Gliffy editor
*Result:* Gliffy diagrams appear on top of the editable sections and not inside the text sections
*Expected:* Gliffy diagram is placed inside a section.

*Problem:*
Removing or moving the new Gliffy diagram doesn't remove the spacing on top.
!aditional spaces top.jpeg|thumbnail!

h3. Notes:
Gliffy is a third party add-on developed by https://www.gliffy.com

h3.Workaround
Recreate all sections manually to remove the spacing on top.
fields.summary: Add-ons can add content outside the Page Layout sections and line breaks can't be edited

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to edit an existing Confluence page the editor shows a blank screen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click edit next for any existing page

h3. Expected Results

Editor opens containing existing content.

h3. Actual Results

Editor opens with no content on the screen.

h3.Workaround

We are working to release a fix asap, in the interim you can open the page in a new tab or window (either middle mouse click or right mouse click and select open in new tab) to workaround this problem.

Alternatively you can install a connect add-on from 'Find new add-ons' section, the Google Maps add-on is a free add-on you can install from https://<instance-url>.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/upm/marketplace/search?q=google%20maps%20for%20confluence. Installing a connect add-on works around this problem.
fields.summary: Confluence shows a blank page when editing existing content

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On Confluence Cloud, Japanese characters on MS Office Word docs are displayed as square characters when thumbnail view and expand view are used. However, MS Office Word macro renders those characters correctly.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attach japanese.docx to a page on Confluence Cloud

h3. Expected Results
Japanese characters are rendered correctly

h3. Actual Results
Japanese characters are displayed as square characters
 
h3. Notes
- Those characters are displayed as square characters when thumbnail view and expand view are used, however they are displayed correctly when MS Office Word macro is used
- On Confluence Server (not Cloud), the problem does not happen if Japanese font files are installed on OS and JVM as instructed in [Non-ASCII Characters display as Square Characters in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Non-ASCII+Characters+display+as+Square+Characters+in+Confluence]

h3.Workaround
Please use MS Word macro instead
fields.summary: On Confluence Cloud, Japanese characters on MS Office Word docs are displayed as square characters

fields.description: FYI this isn't acceptable…
fields.summary: Unable to scroll to view the entire comment when editing a file comment

fields.description: The thumbnail works fine on mini mode.  But on the actual page display, it does not show up.  If it can work in mini mode, it should work on the page view.
fields.summary: Bug: svg images thumbnails don't display on page (but they display on mini-mode)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Page include macro will include 'Space key' if there is special character like colon [:] in the page title that under the same space.

h3. How to replicate
# Create a parent page that will contain *Include Page* macro.
# Create a child page that contain colon, for example: 'Atlassian : Testing Page'
# Insert *Include Page* macro in the parent page.
# Search for 'Atlassian : Testing Page'
# The edit window will show the page title with the 'Space key' even if the parent and child page under the same Space, as you can see at the below image
#- !Selection_141.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Result
The title in the *Include Page* edit window should not show 'Space key'

h3. Actual Result
The title in the *Include Page* edit window shows 'Space key'

h3. Workaround
Remove the special character in the title of the page
fields.summary: Include Page macro will include 'Space key' if there is special character like colon [:] in the page title

fields.description:
We are facing with "Page Not Found" error when trying to reach a page through another page (which includes the link). I have permission and the page does exist. When I find the page link from page tree and click into it, there is no problem but, when I'm trying to reach it through another page's task list, I'm not able to. My teammates are facing with this problem, too. 
From task list:
https://biesterfeld.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=29131068?focusedTaskId=18
I've faced with.

My problem is about reaching to other meeting notes' page from a task list. For example:
https://biesterfeld.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=29131068&focusedTaskId=18
on this page,there is a task, which appears on 
"2015-02-23 Haftalık Satış Toplantımız" meeting notes and I want to use that link from the list.
I'm not trying to mark the task, I'm trying to go to the page that task appears originally.
We are not facing with this problem with all of the links which includes special letters, actually just on that task report.

fields.description:
h3. Problem
User can be found using user macro @ on the page and comment. However, when typing the same username on *Edit restriction* screen, it shows "Searching...." forever.

h3. Expected Results
The user should be shown as in result when the first three letters of username are entered.

h3. Actual Results
The system shows "Searching...." forever even if full username or fullname is entered.
!Screenshot1.jpeg|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
There's no workaround at the moment.

For some instances, users can be found by typing the fullname or full username.

Excerpt Include macro fails to load contents of Table Filter macro.

h3. Environment
This is currently happening for Confluence Cloud {{6.0.0-OD-2015.50}}. The macro loads fine on Confluence Server {{5.8.4}} and {{5.8.10}}.

# Create page A
# Add a Table Filter Macro into an Excerpt Macro
# Create page B

h3. Expected Results
The excerpt include macro renders the contents with the table filter macro, i.e 
* Page A that contains the Table Filter Macro
!upload (1).png|thumbnail!
* Page B with the Excerpt Include Macro 
!upload.png|thumbnail!


h3. Actual Results
The excerpt include macro does not render the contents with the table filter macro and displays an infinite loading icon.
!Screen Shot 2015-12-27 at 11.24.42 PM.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
Under certain macro conditions the Space Contributors Macro presents itself with an incorrect white space formatting.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a Confluence page
# Insert the Contributors macro
## uncheck the "Show Last Contribution Time?" option
## Display format: "Inline"
# Edit the page with more than one user.

h3. Expected
The macro would show the list of users separated by commas followed by a white space.

!contributors.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
The Attachments macro can be configured to filter the list of attachments by labels. When this is configured, uploading attachments by clicking the "browse for files" macro will apply those labels to the uploaded attachments. This is a vital feature for the way I have designed our page layout.

However, the labels don't get added when using the drag and drop target in the macro. Presumably this would be desired as behaviour would be consistent within the macro regardless of upload mechanism. The current behaviour is very confusing to new users and would require education.

I assume the drag and drop target of the whole page is on top of the drag and drop target of the macro and is overriding it.
fields.summary: Attachments macro doesn't add labels to uploaded attachments when dragged and dropped

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After the [October 28th Release | https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/25-october-2015-to-31-october-2015-785619063.html] Confluence update {{Confluence 5.9.1-OD-2015.44}}

If you add the [Content By Label Macro | https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/content-by-label-macro-724765178.html] to the welcome Message on the default Homepage in Confluence an additional page break is added after the bullet point.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# [Edit the Site Welcome Message as Described here | https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/editing-the-site-welcome-message-724765520.html]
# [Add a Content By Label Macro in the Welcome message | https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/content-by-label-macro-724765178.html]

h3. Expected Results
The Macro Will be formatted linearly (left to right) as it is on any other page:
!Screen Shot 2015-11-09 at 6.28.13 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
Adds Bullet Point then drops a line for each item:
!Screen Shot 2015-11-09 at 6.28.57 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
Create a custom page with the desired layout and set the new page as the homepage as described here:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/configuring-the-site-home-page-724765517.html
fields.summary: Formatting broken when Content by label macro used in default Homepage welcome message

bandanaid | bandanacontext |             bandanakey              |                                 bandanavalue
-----------+----------------+-------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  14450711 | {page_title}          | atlassian.confluence.theme.settings |
                                                                  : <map>
                                                                  :   <entry>
                                                                  :     <string>theme.key</string>
                                                                  :     <string>com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.doctheme:documentation</string>
                                                                  :   </entry>
                                                                  : </map>
(1 row)
{noformat}
# As you can see, we need to remove {{com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.doctheme:documentation}} from {{bandavalue}}
# Then run the update in the SQL, as per below:
#- {code} update bandana set bandanavalue = replace(bandanavalue, 'com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.doctheme:documentation','') where bandanakey like 'atlassian.confluence.theme.settings' and bandanavalue like '%com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.doctheme:documentation%'; {code}
# Flush the cache to get the effect of database update

fields.description:
h3. Summary
CONF-38578 fix did not include the fixes for Adaptavist Rollover Macro. When using Rollover Macro, custom CSS entered into the page is not honored.

h3. Environment
Atlassian Confluence Cloud 6.0.0-OD

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create a page with:
# Custom CSS in a CSS Stylesheet macro
# An HTML table macro containing a Table Row, and some Table Cells inside Rollover macros:
{code}
HTML Table
-->Table Row 
----> Rollover macro
------> Table Cell
----> Rollover macro
------> Table Cell
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The custom CSS would be applied, and the table layout would be correct, eg each cell would be placed horizontally in the row:
||Cell 1||Cell 2||Cell 3||

h3. Actual Results
The CSS is not applied, and the table is not layed out correctly, ie each cell is placed vertically on top of each other, rather than horizontally in the row:
|Cell 1|
|Cell 2|
|Cell 3|
 
h3.Workaround
Remove the Rollover macro.

NB: This issue will need to be resolved by Adaptavist in their Content Formatting Macros plugin. We are currently working with them to resolve this.
fields.summary: Rollover macro from Content Formatting Macros strips CSS/HTML formatting

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When editing Space Permissions, if a group with an apostrophe in it's name is already present or is added, attempting to save the permissions will cause the page\browser to crash. In Chrome the page will become unresponsive and has to be killed. Firefox reports that a script has become unresponsive and references https://ajax.googleapis.com/aj…ibs/jquery/1.7.2/jquery.min.js:3. 

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a group with an apostrophe in the name
# Edit space permissions and add the group
# Click Save

h3. Expected Results
Space permissions are saved successfully.

h3. Actual Results
Page\browser crashes.

h3.Workaround
Firefox appears to actually save the changes despite the error. Useful for removing instances where a group with apostrophe is already present.
fields.summary: Space Permissions Fail to Save When Group Name Contains Apostrophe

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Uploading Large Confluence attachments over 200MB result is page errors. 

h3. Environment

* Confluence Version 1000.128.0


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log into a Confluence instance (https://<example>.atlassian.net/wiki/)
# Navigate to Space > Page
# Right menu > ... > Attachments
# Attach files > Select file greater than 200MB > Attach

h3. Expected Results

For files to attach without any issues. File to display correctly after attaching

h3. Actual Results

# Attachment uploads to 99% then page timeouts. No Confluence Log error generated when this occurs. 
# Looking at bottom left, it appear the import is still going as it says {{uploading 1%}} and continues to increase. Occasionally it reset upload back down to 0% and goes back up during the Page Unavailable display.
# Page times out
{code}
Page unavailable

Your Atlassian Cloud service is currently unavailable. If it’s around midnight it’s likely due to scheduled maintenance, and your page should be available again soon.

If your page hasn’t appeared again in 5-10 minutes, go ahead and create a support request.
Create a support request
{code}
# After reloading page
{code}
The following error(s) occurred:
Your request could not be processed because a required security token was not present in the request. You may need to re-submit the form or reload the page.
{code}
# Refreshing page after a few minutes will display the attachment. The length of time can vary depending on the size of the attachment. May need to attempt to re-upload attachment for this to work. 
# Behavior is inconsistence, at times the error (#4) stays on attachment page. Other times, the error is removed after page is reloaded.


h3. Notes

* Able to replicate this on several cloud environments. 
* Made sure the attachment size limit was increased from 100MB before testing. 

h3.Workaround
The issue with large uploads (>= 200MiB) in the editor and the "View Page Attachments" drag-and-drop (shown on the right in the screenshot below) was resolved on the 30th of June. The particular issue described above may continue to exist for large uploads (> 150MB), so we recommend using either the editor or the drag-and-drop interface to upload large files while this timeout is fixed.

 !Screen Shot 2016-06-30 at 10.31.24 AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Issue with uploading large attachments in Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
*Description*

On at least some of our confluence pages we have an issue where the comments section of the confluence page appears unanchored from the bottom of the page, and is mistakenly superimposed over the middle of the page.  See attached image.

*Steps to Reproduce*

Not totally clear, but here's what he have on the confluence page:

# Anchor 
# Panel macro
# Table within Panel
# Anchor
# Panel
# Anchor
# Panel
# Anchor
( Following objects embedded in order from outer to inner):
  - Panel
   -- HTML Table
    --- Table Cell
     ---- JIRA chart
    --- Table Cell
     ---- JIRA chart


See attached screenshot:

!Screen Shot 2015-07-30 at 4.png|thumbnail!

*Notes*

Issue does not occur in edit mode; only when page is being viewed.

We can help debug the problem with page, but because of the sensitivity of the information on the page, we'll need to experiment with debugging primarily on our end.  Please let us know what we can do to try to isolate the issue.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Comments overlap with table in Confluence.
